poem:
Title: "Of Shadows and Skies Between"

Espionage dreams of the Orient,
steeped in Thames and Yangtze,
yet gunboats on wide waters-
mere illusions in twilight.

Speak not of whispers, nor
malicious hacks under moon speak,
for these, inside the palaces,
are but myriad ripples on placid ponds. 

Seek dialogue, not discord-
There lie deeper truths,
beneath the crimson flag and hoary lion.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Does China spy on Britain? Of course. But we have more important things to discuss with them | Simon Jenkins Once upon a time Britain would have sent a gunboat up the Yangtze River. That would teach those Chinese a lesson. To hear some MPs talk about Beijing’s espionage activities, you would think gunboats were already on their way. Of course, it is malicious and hurtful for a foreign state patently to hack into Britain’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
